title: Sacral Insufficiency Fractures Mimicking Lumbar Spine Pathology
patient: A 62-year-old, healthy male presented with complaints of low back pain after a trivial fall. Neurology was normal. He had severe tenderness over the sacral region with an antalgic gait. The initial X-ray was unremarkable. He was treated elsewhere with bed rest and analgesics, which brought no relief. MRI was advised. The scan revealed marrow edema in both sacral ala (H Pattern), which was suggestive of SIF (). Since pain was severe even at rest, sacroplasty was advised and was performed as before (). The patient had immediate pain relief and was mobilized and discharged the same day.
